drjoliv.fjava.adt

Class Try<A>

  • java.lang.Object
    • drjoliv.fjava.adt.Try<A>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Applicative<Try.μ,A>, Functor<Try.μ,A>, Hkt<Try.μ,A>, Witness, Monad<Try.μ,A>

    public class Try<A>
extends Object
implements Monad<Try.μ,A>, Hkt<Try.μ,A>
    Softens exceptions by wrapping thrown exceptions into the a Failure instance of Try and wrapping success into Success.
    Author:
    Desonte 'drjoliv' Jolivete : drjoliv@gmail.com

      static class  Try.μ
      The witness type of Try.

      • run

        public Either<Exception,A> run()
        Runs this Try returning it result. If an exception was thrown and not recovered from the either will contain an exception or the result otherwise.
        Returns:
        an either containing an exception or the result.

      • recoverWith

        public Try<A> recoverWith(Try<A> t)

      • recoverWith

        public <E extends Exception> Try<A> recoverWith(Class<E> cls,
                                                F1<E,Try<A>> fn)
        Recovers with a try created from a function if this try is a failure and if the failure's exception matches the given excpetion class.
        Parameters:
        cls - the class of the excpetion to match against
        fn - the function used to generate a try to recover with.
        Returns:
        a try created from a function if this try is a failure.

      • recover

        public Try<A> recover(Class<? extends Exception> cls,
                      A a)
        Recovers from a try of failure with the given argument the exception within the failure matches the class given.
        Parameters:
        cls - the class of the exception to match against.
        a - the value injected into a try used to recover with.
        Returns:
        a try injected with a if this is af failure or returns this otherwise.
